WHOLE-MOUNT B-GAL STAINS OF EMBRYOS
(after Hiromi et al. (1985) Cell 43, 603-613; modified by C. Dearolf J. Topol)
1. Dechorionate on double-stick tape or in 2.5% Na hypochlorite (lzl
bleach:H2O). Transfer embryos to "deep well" depression slide
filled with heptane solution described in next step.
2. Fix with heptane saturated with [25% glutaraldehyde, 50mM cacodylate
buffer, pH 7.3] 15' with gentle shaking.
3. Sucl< off all fixative, or allow it to care that embryos
are not exposed to the air for more than a few seconds.)
4. Add 3.5% ficoll in lx Ringer solution. Sink embryos. Devitellinize.
5. Suck off iicoll/Ringers and add staining solution. (Alternative: Use
dissecting needles to lift embryos individually into a depression slide
already containing staining solution.) 
6. Allow to develop in chamber humidified with lx Ringers Room Temperature for as long as 24 hours.
7. After staining, use dissecting needles to transfer embryos to drop of
100% glycerol placed between two mounted coverslips. Carefully place
a third coverslip over the glycerol so that it is supported by the
other two.
SOLUTIONS:
Drosophila Ringer (10x):
15 NaCl
0.7 
0.42 CaCl;
add ddH2O to 200 ml. pH should be 7.2
Staining Solution (for 1 ml):
850 |11 35% ficoll in lx Ringers
60 ul 5% X-gal in DMF
(vortex)
50 ul 200 mM buffer, pH 8
(vortex(.007g for 200ul)
(vortex)
